intro: Pycnocoma macrophylla var. longicornuta, commonly known as the longhorned pycnocoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
